metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3965 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in ffmpeg. This vulnerability affects the function smc_encode_stream of the file libavcodec/smcenc.c of the component QuickTime Graphics Video Encoder. The manipulation of the argument y_size leads to out-of-bounds read. The attack can be initiated remotely. The name of the patch is 13c13109759090b7f7182480d075e13b36ed8edd. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-213544.

notes.Note: ccdm94> the Apple Graphics (SMC) Encoder functions are not available in ffmpeg before version 5.0, meaning, versions before 5.0 are not vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
